uk.ac.ed.csbe.sbsivisual.sbsiDataFormat
Class SBSIDataFormatUtilities

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ed.csbe.sbsivisual.sbsiDataFormat.SBSIDataFormatUtilities

public class SBSIDataFormatUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

Provides some utility methods for linking together header, data and model files.

Author:
Richard Adams

getColumnNames

public static java.lang.String[] getColumnNames(java.io.File dataFile)
                                         throws SBSIParseException
Utility method to extract the column names from an SBSI data file

Parameters:
dataFile - A Filerepresenting an SBSI data format data file
Returns:
A String [] of header columns, or null if none are found
Throws:
SBSIParseException
{@link - IndexOutOfBoundsException} if the file has less than BSIFormatRegexps4.COLUMN_HEADER_SEPARATOR number of lines
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file is null or unreadable.

getMaxEndPoint

public double getMaxEndPoint(java.util.List<ISBSIData> datasets)
Given a list of datasets, will find the latest time point of all the data sets.

Parameters:
datasets - A possible empty, but not nullList of ISBSIData objects
Returns:
The latest end point time as a double.

getMinEndPoint

public double getMinEndPoint(java.util.List<ISBSIData> datasets)
Given a list of datasets, will find the MINIMUM last time point of all the data sets.

Parameters:
datasets - A possible empty, but not nullList of ISBSIData objects
Returns:
The MINIMUM last end point time as a double.

getReferencedFile

public static java.io.File getReferencedFile(java.io.File actualFile,
                                             java.lang.String referencedFileStr)
Attempts to find a file referenced from another file.
The referenced file can be an absolute or relative path.

Parameters:
actualFile - A non-null File object that contains a reference to another file
referencedFileStr - A non-null String of an absolute or relative pathname of actualFile
Returns:
A file, the referenced file if referred-to file exists, or null if the referenced file could not be found.

getModelFileFromDataFile

public static java.io.File getModelFileFromDataFile(java.io.File dataFile)
                                             throws SBSIParseException
Given an sbsi data file, looks for header file, and for model file annotation value. If any of these are missing, returns null.

Parameters:
dataFile - An existing, readable sbsi data file
Returns:
an existing, readable model file (SBML) or null
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file is null, or is not readable
SBSIParseException

getHeaderFileFromDataFile

public static java.io.File getHeaderFileFromDataFile(java.io.File dataFile)
                                              throws SBSIParseException
Throws:
SBSIParseException

getHeaderFromDataFile

public SBSIHeaderDocument getHeaderFromDataFile(java.io.File dataFile)
                                         throws SBSIParseException
Convenience method, which, given a data file, finds its corresponding header file, or null if the header file could not be found.

Parameters:
dataFile. - A readable, existing File object
Returns:
The SBSIHeaderDocument file referenced by the data file, or null if not found.
Throws:
SBSIParseException - if header file could not be parsed.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dataFile is null or not readable.

parseNumber

public static java.lang.Double parseNumber(java.lang.String original)
Utility function so strip extraneous characters from a number, and parse the number. ' ' and ',' characters are stripped

Parameters:
original - A String of a candidate number
Returns:
A Double, or null is number cannot be parsed.
